core

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Display

  • public class Display
extends java.lang.Object
    Display.java --- A class used for displaying all sorts of basic information on the map and on the screen.
    Author:
    P H - 18.03.2017

    • Method Detail

      • showUnitTile

        public static void showUnitTile(bwapi.Unit unit,
                                bwapi.Color color)
        Function for displaying a single Unit / draw a box around the tile the Unit is currently on.
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit on whose current TilePosition a box is being drawn.
        color - the Color that will be used for drawing the box.

      • drawTile

        public static void drawTile(int posX,
                            int posY,
                            int tileWidth,
                            int tileHeight,
                            bwapi.Color color)
        Draw a Box around one or more tiles on the map.
        Parameters:
        posX - the X Position the box will start at (Upper left corner).
        posY - the Y Position the box will start at (Upper left corner).
        tileWidth - the width of the box in tiles.
        tileHeight - the height of the box in tiles.
        color - the Color that the box will be displayed in.

      • drawTileFilled

        public static void drawTileFilled(int posX,
                                  int posY,
                                  int tileWidth,
                                  int tileHeight,
                                  bwapi.Color color)
        Draw a filled Box around one or more tiles on the map.
        Parameters:
        posX - the X Position the box will start at (Upper left corner).
        posY - the Y Position the box will start at (Upper left corner).
        tileWidth - the width of the box in tiles.
        tileHeight - the height of the box in tiles.
        color - the Color that the box will be displayed in.

      • showUnitTarget

        public static void showUnitTarget(bwapi.Unit unit,
                                  bwapi.Color color)
        Function for displaying the target Position of a Unit with a line towards it.
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit whose target Position is being displayed.
        color - the Color of the line towards the Unit's target Position.

      • showUnits

        public static void showUnits(java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> units)
        Function for displaying a given List of Units on the screen. This function displays the name of the UnitType as well as the number of times that UnitType was found inside the List.
        Parameters:
        units - the List of Units that is going to be displayed.

      • showList

        private static void showList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list,
                             int offsetX,
                             int offsetY)
        Function for displaying a List of Strings on the screen.
        Parameters:
        list - the List that is going to be displayed.
        offsetX - the offset to the left.
        offsetY - the offset to the right.

      • showGameInformation

        public static void showGameInformation(InformationStorage informationStorage)
        Wrapper function for displaying internal game information like the elapsed time, APM or FPS.
        Parameters:
        informationStorage -

      • showTime

        private static void showTime(int offsetX,
                             int offsetY)
        Function for displaying the elapsed time. This includes the time in minutes, seconds and frames.
        Parameters:
        offsetX - the offset to the left.
        offsetY - the offset to the right.

      • showAPM

        private static void showAPM(int offsetX,
                            int offsetY)
        Function for displaying the current APM counter.
        Parameters:
        offsetX - the offset to the left.
        offsetY - the offset to the right.

      • showFPS

        private static void showFPS(int offsetX,
                            int offsetY)
        Function for displaying the current FPS counter.
        Parameters:
        offsetX - the offset to the left.
        offsetY - the offset to the right.

      • showBoundaries

        private static void showBoundaries(java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Pair<bwta.Region,Polygon>> mapBoundaries)
        Function for displaying the map's boundaries on the screen.
        Parameters:
        mapBoundaries - the map's boundaries that are going to be displayed.

      • showReservedSpacePolygons

        private static void showReservedSpacePolygons(java.util.HashSet<Polygon> reservedSpacePolygons)
        Function for displaying all Polygons that represent the reserved space on the map. No buildings can be constructed on TilePositions in this Polygon.
        Parameters:
        reservedSpacePolygons - the reserved space Polygons that are going to be displayed.

      • showMineralBlockedChokePoints

        private static void showMineralBlockedChokePoints(java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Pair<bwapi.Unit,bwta.Chokepoint>> blockedChokePoints)
        Function for displaying all mineral blocked ChokePoints as well as the mineral patches that are blocking them. These ChokePoints can not be traversed by default.
        Parameters:
        blockedChokePoints - the blocked ChokePoints that are going to be displayed.

      • showBreadthAccessOrder

        private static void showBreadthAccessOrder(java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashSet<bwta.Region>> breadthAccessOrder)
        Function for displaying the breadth access order in which the different Regions can be accessed by the Bot. The Points connected by the Vectors are the centers of the Regions.
        Parameters:
        breadthAccessOrder - the breadth Region access order that is going to be displayed.

      • showContendedTilePositions

        private static void showContendedTilePositions(java.util.HashSet<bwapi.TilePosition> tilePositionContenders)
        Function for displaying the contended / blocked TilePositions on the map. These are the ones that a worker is currently trying to construct a building on and / or is prohibited to build onto.
        Parameters:
        tilePositionContenders - the contended / blocked TilePositions that are going to be displayed.
